      • createPlayer

        Player createPlayer(java.lang.String token,
                    int gameID,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    PlayerColor color)
             throws InvalidUsernameException,
                    InvalidGameIdException,
                    InvalidColorException
        Function to create a new player and make him join the selected game. If the selected game is full or if it is already started he will be notified. When the minimum number of player has been reached a gameTimer, at the end of which the game can be played, is started When the maximum number of player has been reached the gameTimer is stopped and the game automatically started
        Parameters:
        token - of the player that has done the request
        gameID - of the game to join
        name - requested by the client for his player
        color - requested by the client for his player
        Throws:
        InvalidUsernameException - in case of username requested already exists
        InvalidGameIdException - in case of invalid game id. So if the game is full, or already started, or there's not a game in the index given
        InvalidColorException - in case of color requested already exists

        Parameters:

        endMode - the type of ending chosen by user: final frenzy or sudden death

      • getMaps

        java.util.List<MapInfo> getMaps()

      • checkStartingGame

        void checkStartingGame(int gameID)
        Methods to check if a game has to be started. It checks if the minimum number of player has been reached. In this case a timer is start at the end of which the game is started and the active player is set. If the maximum number of players is reached the game is started automatically.
        Parameters:
        gameID - the id of the game to check

      • getAlreadyLoggedUser

        boolean getAlreadyLoggedUser(java.lang.String alreadyExistingToken)

      • playerQuit

        int playerQuit(java.lang.String token)
        Method to quit a player. It removes it from the gaemManager and from all of the structure in this class.
        Parameters:
        token - the player to quit
        Returns:
        the integer representing the game from which the player has been quit

      • getGameIdFromListener

        private int getGameIdFromListener(ViewProxy viewProxy,
                                  java.util.Collection<java.util.List<ViewProxy>> proxyViews)
        Method to return the game to which a given view is related
        Parameters:
        viewProxy - the view to which is wanted to know the game
        proxyViews - the list from which to check among
        Returns:
        the integer representing the game id

      • disconnectToken

        void disconnectToken(java.lang.String token)
        Method to disconnect a player from the game. The player is inserted in some maps to retrieve information later on reconnecion. All the other players are warned about the disconnection. If the game cannot be played anymore because the remaining players are less than the minimum number of players the game is quit.
        Parameters:
        token - the token of the player to disconnect

      • disconnectWhileLoading

        void disconnectWhileLoading(java.lang.String token)
        Function to disconnect a token during the phase of loading if server crash. Contrary on what happen during normal disconnection, this function will not notify players and will not end the game
        Parameters:
        token - the player to disconnect

      • notifyOfDisconnection

        private void notifyOfDisconnection(boolean all,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   int game)
        notify views of a game about a player that has disconnected
        Parameters:
        all - boolean to indicate if each player of the game has to quit
        name - the name of the player that has disconnected
        game - the game in which the player that has disconnected was playing

      • restartPlayerTimer

        void restartPlayerTimer(int game)
        this method restart the turn timer for the player who's choosing now.
        Parameters:
        game - the game in which the new timer has to be initialised and started

      • endGame

        void endGame(int game,
             java.lang.String causePlayer)

        Parameters:
        game - the game to close
        causePlayer -

      • reconnectUserCauseConnection

        void reconnectUserCauseConnection(java.lang.String alreadyExistingToken,
                                  ViewListener viewListener)
        This method reconnects the disconnected client, removing his token from the disconnected ones.
        Parameters:
        alreadyExistingToken - the client to reconnect
        viewListener - the new viewListener associated to the client

      • reconnectUserCauseInactive

        void reconnectUserCauseInactive(java.lang.String token)
        In this method the disconnected client (for inactivity) is reconnected to the game he was in before. All the related proxys and virtual Views are set the same way they were before disconnection. The client (token) is removed from the disconnected ones. The ping Timer restarts and the client is notified of his reconnection In case the client has disconnected before a spawn action, then he's going to do an exceptional spawn action during his first turn after being reconnected.
        Parameters:
        token - the client that needs to be reconnected

      • isActiveToken

        boolean isActiveToken(java.lang.String alreadyExistingToken)

      • isCurrentPlayerForGame

        boolean isCurrentPlayerForGame(int game,
                               java.lang.String token)
        Given a token this methos says if he is the current player
        Parameters:
        game - the game of which is asked the current player
        token - the token of which is asked if he is the current player
        Returns:
        true if "token" player is the current player, false otherwise
